title: .h5 FileNotFoundError - Evaluate Results
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
CentOS 7 using an Anaconda Environment and DeepLabCut 2.0.6.

Using an HPC Grid to complete the evaluation (which worked successfully to train the network)

**Describe the problem**

When I try to evaluate the trained video results, I get a filenotfounderror return saying that the .h5 file does not exist in the newly created evaluation_results folder. Does not appear to be a channels issue as is the case in issue #28.

**How to Reproduce the problem**
import deeplabcut
config_path = '/mnt/research/hhorch/jeschole/190618-Julie-2019-06-18/config.yaml'
deeplabcut.evaluate_network(config_path, plotting=True)

Error returned:

Use standard file APIs to check for files with this prefix.

0it [00:00, ?it/s]
DLC loaded in light mode; you cannot use the labeling GUI!
DLC loaded in light mode; you cannot use the relabeling GUI!
Running  DeepCut_resnet50_190618Jun18shuffle1_1030000  with # of trainingiterations: 1030000
Analyzing data...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/evaluate.py", line 153, in evaluate_network
    DataMachine = pd.read_hdf(resultsfilename,'df_with_missing')
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/pandas/io/pytables.py", line 371, in read_hdf
    'File %s does not exist' % path_or_buf)
FileNotFoundError: File /mnt/research/hhorch/jeschole/190618-Julie-2019-06-18/evaluation-results/iteration-0/190618Jun18-trainset95shuffle1/DeepCut_resnet50_190618Jun18shuffle1_1030000-snapshot-1030000.h5 does not exist

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/mnt/research/hhorch/jeschole/190618-Julie-2019-06-18/HPC_Scripts/evaluate_network-190618.py", line 3, in <module>
    deeplabcut.evaluate_network(config_path, plotting=True)
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/evaluate.py", line 163, in evaluate_network
    image = io.imread(os.path.join(cfg['project_path'],imagename),mode='RGB')
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/skimage/io/_io.py", line 61, in imread
    img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args)
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/skimage/io/manage_plugins.py", line 210, in call_plugin
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python36/root/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/imageio/core/functions.py", line 202, in imread
    raise TypeError('Invalid keyword argument "mode", '
TypeError: Invalid keyword argument "mode", perhaps you mean "pilmode"?

**Additional context**
I trained a new project with a different video and got the same error when I tried the evaluate_network command. 
Thanks for your help!
